meanings.definition: Relating to the study of lichens.
meanings.sent1: The lichenological research team discovered new species in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use lichenological methods to understand the ecosystem better.
meanings.sent3: The lichenological expedition turned into a fun adventure in the woods.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a lichenological microscope, observing every detail.
meanings.sent5: The lichenological field guide made identifying lichens easy for beginners.

meanings.definition: Involving the scientific study of lichens.
meanings.sent1: Their lichenological experiments provided valuable data for the research.
meanings.sent2: The lichenological lab was filled with samples waiting to be analyzed.
meanings.sent3: The lichenological investigation led to unexpected results that amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to lichenological studies was as strong as a rock.
meanings.sent5: The lichenological report summarized the findings in a clear and concise manner.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the branch of biology that focuses on lichens.
meanings.sent1: The lichenological conference attracted experts from around the world.
meanings.sent2: Students interested in lichenological biology attended the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The lichenological lecture was so engaging that even non-scientists enjoyed it.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for lichenological research shone through in every project.
meanings.sent5: The lichenological textbook provided a comprehensive overview of the subject.
